ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I learned how to read and write Hindi. I learned a lot of grammar principles and began to start speaking as well. I am amazed at how much Hindi I picked up on only a few months.
Hindi! I develop significantly more speaking ability than I previously had.
Basic sentences in Hindi, Hindu culture, and speaking in Hindi
The fundamentals of Hindi vocabulary and grammar as well as a near complete understanding of the written script.
Basic conversation skills, reading and weiting
I learned basic Hindi vocab, grammar, verb tenses, and sentence structures.
I learned so much. I learned how to speak Hindi on the spot.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: The course was very fun but could have been improved with more structure/ clear cut grading policies
I think that the teaching in the class is done very well. One thing that can be improved is that the grades could be a bit more transparent.
Great introduction to Hindi. Would be nice to have more listening exercises.

The course does a great job of taking students through the base material behind the language without going too fast or overwhelming the students with too much all at once. There are also a remarkable amount of out-of-class opportunities for additional mentorship and tutoring. The only problem with the course is that material is a bit scattered at times. Sometimes it felt like there wasn't a clear program of study; we'd jump from one topic to the next without complete explanation. I still learned a lot though, so just a minor fault.
More opportunities for conversation in class

I like how they are so open to asking questions and always encourage speaking in Hindi inside and outside class. However, I think the class could use more structure and I wish our grades were posted online.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: YES! Hindi is such a fun language and both instructors really care about their students' learning process
I would highly recommend this class to anyone that wants to learn a new language and about a great culture!
Yes! Swapna ji is incredible!

Yes. It was a very interesting class and I enjoyed learning. Seema Ji and Swapna Ji are great teachers. They understand that not every student comes from the same background and do a great job adjusting accordingly. I am certainly glad I took it.

Yes, especially if the language is of cultural significance to you, the professors do a fantastic job of providing you the tools necessary to read, write and speak the language in a relatively low-stress environment.
Absolutely, amazing language class, not too stressful, weekly quizzes and midterm/final projects are very conducive to learning the language but also very stress free
I would probably recommend this course to other students -- if you want to learn Hindi, this is a good way to do so.
Yes! I love learning Hindi and our professors.
